item.title: Opensource Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) USB dongle
item.description: If you’ve ever had to ship a product you know how frustrating a critical bug can be when your only driver is proprietary. Many times the problem may be in your code and not the vendor’s code, but it is often a difficult journey to find the root cause. Vendors have many customers and finding the right technical contact takes time, and without a compelling business case you may ultimately find that your use of the device is not standard and you end up at the back of the line, even sometimes forced to find a different component. Well with Zephyr maybe we are beginning to take a step forward, as we now have an entirely open source BLE solution from the host to the client, and there are vendors that are talking about possibly providing an almost ready-for-certification Bluetooth low energy radio stack based on Zephyr.
